intro: Annamocalamus kontumensis, commonly known as the Kontum bamboo, is a species of grass-like plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender culms and narrow, linear leaves. This plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem. However, it is relatively rare and faces threats from habitat loss and environmental changes.
